outcome.title: Types of Variables
outcome.description: I can distinguish types and subcategories of variables.

outcome.title: Sampling Techniques
outcome.description: I can identify different sampling techniques.

outcome.title: Visualizing Data
outcome.description: Given a sample of data, I can generate visualizations to represent it's variables.

outcome.title: Centers of Data
outcome.description: Given a sample of data, I can identify or compute different measures of centrality.

outcome.title: Variation of Data
outcome.description: Given a sample of data, I can identify or compute different measures of variation, and identify outliers.

outcome.title: Introduction to Probability
outcome.description: I can compute and interpret probabilities of events, including compound events involving operations.

outcome.title: Conditional Probability
outcome.description: I can compute and interpret probability of events involving conditional probabilities.

outcome.title: Bayes Theorem
outcome.description: I can utilize Bayes Theorem in the computation and interpretation of probabilities.

outcome.title: Random Variables
outcome.description: I can compute and interpret probabilities from the probability distribution of a random variable, as well as compute and interpret the expectation, variance and standard deviation of a random variable.

outcome.title: Linear Combinations of Random Variables
outcome.description: I can compute and interpret the expectation, variance and standard deviation of linear combinations of random variables.

outcome.title: Standard Normal Distribution
outcome.description: I can compute and interpret probabilities given bounds, and bounds given probabilities for the standard normal variable.

outcome.title: General Normal Distribution
outcome.description: I can compute and interpret probabilities given bounds, and bounds given probabilities for general normal variables.

outcome.title: Counting Principles
outcome.description: I can count ordered and unordered selections of objects, with or without repitition.

outcome.title: Binomial Distribution
outcome.description: I can compute and interpret probabilities for binomial random variables.

outcome.title: Normal Approximation of Binomial Distribution
outcome.description: I can use the normal approximation for binomial random variables to compute probabilities and bounds.

outcome.title: Point Estimates
outcome.description: I can identify point estimates for parameters of interest.

outcome.title: Confidence Intervals
outcome.description: I can find a confidence interval for the true proportion of a categorical variable, given a sample, and interpret the meaning of this interval.

outcome.title: Hypothesis Testing
outcome.description: I can test hypothesis about the true proportion of a categorical variable, given a sample: stating the null and alternative hypothesis, computing a p-value, explaining the meaning of the p-value and drawing a conclusion.

outcome.title: Size of Sample: Proportion
outcome.description: I can identify the sample size neccesary for a confidence interval to have a given margin of error.

outcome.title: Two Categorical Variable Inferences
outcome.description: I can perform hypothesis tests and compute confidence intervals for the differences of proportions, and explain the results.

outcome.title: Chi^2 goodness of fit test
outcome.description: I can use chi^2 tests to test the goodness of fit of a sample, and explain the results.

outcome.title: Chi^2 independence test
outcome.description: I can use chi^2 tests to test the independence of categorical variables and explain the results.

outcome.title: t-distribution
outcome.description: I can compute and interpret probabilities given bounds, and bounds given probabilities for standard t-variables.

outcome.title: Inference for single Numerical Variables
outcome.description: I can perform hypothesis tests and compute confidence intervals for the means of numerical variables, and explain the results.

outcome.title: Inference for paired Numerical Variables
outcome.description: I can perform hypothesis tests and compute confidence intervals for the means of differences of paired numerical variables, and explain the results.

outcome.title: Inference for difference of means of Numerical Variables
outcome.description: I can perform hypothesis tests and compute confidence intervals for the differences of means of numerical variables, and explain the results.

outcome.title: Size of Sample: Means
outcome.description: I can find the sample size of a numerical variables needed to find confidence intervals with given margin of errors, and detect differences in means given a power.

outcome.title: ANOVA
outcome.description: I can use ANOVA to test if variation between groups can be explained solely through the variation within groups and explain the results.

outcome.title: Linear Correlation of Variables
outcome.description: I can compute and interpret the correlation coefficient and it's square for a regression analysis.

outcome.title: Interpreting Linear Regression
outcome.description: I can find the parameters for the regression line, explain the parameters, and use it to make predictions from the linear model.

outcome.title: Inference and Linear Regression
outcome.description: I can perform hypothesis tests and compute confidence intervals for the parameters of the regression line and explain the results.
